title: Customer Retention Generates Revenue, but Churn Creates Costs
summary: This article discusses the financial impact of customer churn, differentiating between voluntary and involuntary churn. It highlights that involuntary churn, often caused by failed payments, can account for a significant portion of total churn and emphasizes the importance of effective recovery solutions to maximize customer retention and revenue.
key_points: Customer retention is crucial for ongoing revenue generation.
Involuntary churn, due to failed payments, can be up to 50% of total churn.
Effective churn reduction initiatives are vital for assessing the value of saved customers.
Specialized recovery solutions can improve recovery rates compared to in-house methods.
